summary: Now, I’m not a learned man, but the best way to help the most people might not be sitting in a frozen castle at the edge of the...
caption: Now, I’m not a learned man, but the best way to help the most people might not be sitting in a frozen castle at the edge of the world. It might mean wading in the muck, getting your boots dirty, and doing what needs to be done.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: My unpopular opinion will be that I want Jon to stay dead in the books because other characters such as Rickon, Stannis and...
question: My unpopular opinion will be that I want Jon to stay dead in the books because other characters such as Rickon, Stannis and Aegon could carry the story line better - Rickon as Robb's heir, Stannis as AA and Aegon as son of Rhaegar are enough for me. Why have a zombie in exchange of three characters I love?
answer:
Disagree

I’m actually rather interested in what George will do with Jon’s character in the books. Don’t get me wrong, out of everyone in the first three books, he consistently had the most boring and bland chapters. However, I really think he came into his own in ADWD and George had fixed most of the mistakes with his character and arc (ex: lack of flaws, aimless meandering, etc) and he started becoming a better written character with an actually interesting external struggle. George had referenced multiple times how he hates the idea of someone reincarnating as the same person, and while we do see reincarnation with Catelyn, Jon will probably still be a POV character and I am curious what being in his head will be like after coming back to life. 

Personally, if Jon were to die, I would want Sansa to act as Robb’s heir and rule Winterfell. Rickon is a child, and giving him that much responsibility isn’t a good idea especially when a fully capable character is right there. As much as everyone seems to like Stannis, it’s being showcased multiple times in text that he isn’t Azor Ahai, and the fact that he isn’t despite being told that he is AA is an important part of his character arc. Rather than take Jon out completely, i’ll be interesting to see how his story will go with another person with Targaryen blood in the mix. I think having both of them around will move the plot in a very interesting manner.

summary: Relive Jon Snow’s Journey for the Throne
title: Relive Jon Snow’s Journey for the Throne
body:
There are loads of quotes and videos in Jon’s character journey, but what they really focus on is:

  • Jon in a leadership position. He’s being groomed for command; he’s the Lord Commander; he’s King in the North.
  • Jon’s a good fighter. He’s been trained by ser Rodrik; he fights at Hardhome, in the Battle of the Bastards, and during the wight hunt.
  • “Kill the boy and let the man be born.” Jon beheading Janos Slynt (Kit: “This man is dangerous to his leadership and has directly disobeyed his leadership.”) and how it changes Jon and, according to Kit, kills a bit inside him. Jon beating Ramsay, “A monster has risen in him a bit,” Kit says, “which, I think, should be unsettling for the viewers.”
  • Jon vs the Night King. Hardhome; the wight hunt. Included quote: “The enemy is real. It’s always been real.”
  • Jon and Sansa’s relationship. The first video in the King in the North section focuses mostly on their relationship, the tension between them, teasing a stark!bowl that never happened, and including the forehead kiss (the thumbnail even shows them side by side at the head table as he’s named king, as opposed to a close-up of Jon). Regardless of the nature of their relationship, it’s still a very important part of his journey and so is taking back Winterfell. Included quote: “Winterfell is ours… It belongs to our family. We have to fight for it.”
  • Jon’s identity. He’s not a Stark. In fact, “I’m not a Stark,” is the first quote we see. And the last video in the King in the North section, although it features j0nerys and has a j0nerys thumbnail, focuses mostly on Jon’s parentage. And together with the quote from Bran, “He needs to know the truth,” it highlights how Jon’s identity will be a huge plot point next season. It also points to Truth being more about who Jon is rather than a love story with D/ny.
  • Jon and D/ny. I’m including this even though they don’t focus much on it, because that in and of itself makes it stand out. And while the “All right, not D/ny. How about my queen?” quote is included, it first of all shows us the power dynamic of the relationship. She’s not D/ny to him. She’s his queen. But will she be for long? Because, second of all, it’s followed by the video that explains Jon’s parentage and ends with Bran’s quote. If this were a love story, why not end it with the how about my queen quote? If this were a love story and a T/rgaryen restoration were coming, why not focus more on their romance and the baby foreshadowing? Instead the final section of this journey leaves us on an ominous note: Jon needs to know the truth because it will change everything.

blog.name: winterfellchild
blog.title: The pack survives
blog.description:
"She (Daenerys) has the power to destroy, she can wipe out entire cities, and we
certainly see that in ‘Fire and Blood.’ We see the dragons wiping out 
entire armies, wiping out towns and cities, destroying them, but that 
doesn’t necessarily enable you to rule — it just enables you to destroy." GRRM

hello lovely jonsa fandom! here are my promised festive!jonsa icons! i decided to experiment a bit and make a lot of circle icons but there are still a bunch of normal square ones too! I really enjoyed doing this so please feel free to request icons! much love, and happy holidays! ♡ ♡ ♡

  • 150x150
  • like/reblog if you use any ♡
  • credits are not required but appreciated ♡

  • request icons here

summary: love is all about the wind
title: love is all about the wind
description:
by BittersweetDreamer

Walking swiftly into her chambers, Arya remembers a time Jon had once called her pretty. And as she collapses in the seat by the window, bathed in the fading light of a barely risen sun, she wonders if he still will.

-The Season 8 Reunion Everyone Asked For-

Words: 969, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Rating: Not Rated

  • Characters: Jon Snow, Arya Stark
  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Arya Stark
